meanings.definition: A device used for transmitting or receiving television signals.
meanings.sent1: The teledus in our living room brings us all the latest news and shows.
meanings.sent2: I bought a new teledus for my bedroom to watch my favorite programs.
meanings.sent3: The teledus in the store seemed to have a mind of its own, changing channels randomly.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were glued to the teledus, absorbing every detail of the movie.
meanings.sent5: The teledus hummed softly, filling the room with the sounds of the evening news.

meanings.definition: To communicate or transmit information through a television or other electronic device.
meanings.sent1: We can teledus with our friends through video calls on our phones.
meanings.sent2: He teleduses with his family every Sunday to catch up on their lives.
meanings.sent3: The aliens tried to teledus with us using strange signals from their spaceship.
meanings.sent4: Her smile teledused her happiness to everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The radio teledused the breaking news to listeners across the country.
